text: Hongmei Lin. Author. Riquan Zhang. Author. Tiejun Tong. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Lin H, Zhang R, Tong T (2025). ChauBoxplot: Chauvenet-Type Boxplot. R package version 1.0.0, https://tiejuntong.github.io/ChauBoxplot/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ChauBoxplot: Chauvenet-Type Boxplot},   author = {Hongmei Lin and Riquan Zhang and Tiejun Tong},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://tiejuntong.github.io/ChauBoxplot/}, }

title: Chauvenet-Type Boxplot
text: ChauBoxplot R package designed create improved version boxplot. package implements new fence coefficient proposed Lin et al. (2025), replacing traditional fence coefficient (k=1.5) Tukey’s boxplot. new coefficient (k_n^{Chau}) calculated based Chauvenet’s criterion, given formula (9) paper.

title: Chauvenet-Type Boxplot
text: chau_boxplot(): Generates Chauvenet-type boxplots base R. usage similar boxplot(), employs updated fence coefficient robust outlier detection. geom_chau_boxplot(): Creates Chauvenet-type boxplots ggplot2, functioning similarly geom_boxplot().

title: Chauvenet-Type Boxplot
text: install ChauBoxplot package CRAN, please use following command R: install.packages(“ChauBoxplot”) install ChauBoxplot package GitHub, please use following commands R: library(devtools) install_github(“tiejuntong/ChauBoxplot”)

title: Chauvenet-Type Boxplot
text: detailed documentation usage examples, please visit package website https://tiejuntong.github.io/ChauBoxplot/.

title: Chauvenet-Type Boxplot
text: real example R code create Chauvenet-type boxplot pay adjustment rates senior civil servants Hong Kong.

title: Chauvenet-Type Boxplot
text: library(ggplot2) library(ChauBoxplot) rate.senior <- c(4.96, 6.30, -5.38, 1.60, 7.24, 5.26, 2.55, 5.96, 3.96, 4.19, 1.88, 4.06, 4.75, 0, 0, 2.5, 2.87, 3.00)/100 year <- 2007:2024 data.senior <- data.frame(x=year, y=rate.senior) C.boxplot.senior <- ggplot(data.senior, aes(y=rate.senior)) + geom_chau_boxplot(fill=“purple”,width=3) + theme(legend.position = “none”) + scale_x_discrete(breaks = NULL) + ylim(-0.057,0.077) + theme(plot.margin = unit(c(0, 0, 0, 0), “inches”)) + labs(title=“C.boxplot”, subtitle=“Senior civil servants”, x=““, y=”“) print(C.boxplot.senior)

title: Chauvenet-Type Boxplot
text: Hongmei Lin, Riquan Zhang Tiejun Tong (2025). Tukey meets Chauvenet: new boxplot criterion outlier detection. Journal Computational Graphical Statistics, accepted.

title: Chauvenet-Type Boxplot
text: questions, please feel free contact Tiejun Tong via tongt@hkbu.edu.hk.

title: ChauBoxplot: Chauvenet-type boxplot — ChauBoxplot-package
text: package provides modified boxplot new fence coefficient determined Lin et al. (2025). Specifically, fence coefficient k=1.5 Tukey's boxplot replaced fence coefficient associated Chauvenet’s criterion formula (9). convenience, also provided chauvenet-type boxplot base R function chau_boxplot(), ggplot2 function geom_chau_boxplot().

title: ChauBoxplot: Chauvenet-type boxplot — ChauBoxplot-package

text: function can operated way boxplot() base R, except fence coefficient k=1.5 Tukey's boxplot replaced fence coefficient associated Chauvenet’s criterion. details, please refer formula (9) Lin et al. (2025).

text: function can operated way geom_boxplot() ggplot2, except fence coefficient k=1.5 Tukey's boxplot replaced fence coefficient associated Chauvenet’s criterion. details, please refer formula (9) Lin et al. (2025).

title: Title: Chauvenet-type boxplot in ggplot2 — geom_chau_boxplot
code: geom_chau_boxplot(   mapping = NULL,   data = NULL,   geom = "boxplot",   position = "dodge2",   na.rm = FALSE,   show.legend = NA,   inherit.aes = TRUE,   ... )

title: Title: Chauvenet-type boxplot in ggplot2 — geom_chau_boxplot
text: mapping Aesthetic mappings created `aes()`. data data displayed layer. geom geometric object use display. position position adjustment. na.rm Logical. missing values removed? show.legend Logical. layer included legends? inherit.aes FALSE, overrides default aesthetics. ... arguments passed layer.

title: Title: Chauvenet-type boxplot in ggplot2 — geom_chau_boxplot
text: ggplot2 layer Chauvenet-type boxplot.

title: Title: Chauvenet-type boxplot in ggplot2 — geom_chau_boxplot
text: Hongmei Lin, Riquan Zhang Tiejun Tong (2025). Tukey meets Chauvenet: new boxplot criterion outlier detection. Journal Computational Graphical Statistics, accepted.

title: Title: Chauvenet-type boxplot in ggplot2 — geom_chau_boxplot
code: # Example 1 library(ggplot2)  rate.senior <- c(4.96, 6.30, -5.38, 1.60, 7.24, 5.26, 2.55, 5.96, 3.96,                  4.19, 1.88, 4.06, 4.75, 0, 0, 2.5, 2.87, 3.00)/100 year <- 2007:2024 data.senior <- data.frame(x=year, y=rate.senior)  C.boxplot.senior <-   ggplot(data.senior, aes(y=rate.senior)) +   geom_chau_boxplot(fill="purple",width=3) +   theme(legend.position = "none") +   scale_x_discrete(breaks = NULL) +   ylim(-0.057,0.077) +   theme(plot.margin = unit(c(0, 0, 0, 0), "inches")) +   labs(title="C.boxplot", subtitle="Senior civil servants", x="", y="")  print(C.boxplot.senior)
